summary: Email correspondence between law enforcement officials regarding the drafting of subpoenas for individuals in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails discuss subpoenas for three chefs who worked for Jeffrey Epstein and one of Epstein's ex-assistants.

persons.name: David R Mullen
persons.context: Listed as one of three chefs who worked for Epstein for whom a subpoena is being requested in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Adam Perry Lang
persons.context: Listed as one of three chefs who worked for Epstein for whom a subpoena is being requested in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Lance Allen Calloway
persons.context: Listed as one of three chefs who worked for Epstein for whom a subpoena is being requested in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is requesting confirmation of name spellings before issuing subpoenas to three chefs.

connections.description: David R Mullen is identified as a chef who worked for Jeffrey Epstein.
Adam Perry Lang is identified as a chef who worked for Jeffrey Epstein.
Lance Allen Calloway is identified as a chef who worked for Jeffrey Epstein.
Alison, an AUSA, is involved in the process of issuing subpoenas to David R Mullen as part of the Maxwell case investigation.

events.title: Subpoena Request for Maxwell Case
events.description: Law enforcement officials correspond about drafting subpoenas for four individuals, including three chefs who worked for Epstein and one of Epstein's ex-assistants, in relation to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Subpoenas were being prepared for three chefs (David R Mullen, Adam Perry Lang, Lance Allen Calloway) who worked for Jeffrey Epstein as part of the Ghislaine Maxwell case investigation.
A subpoena was also requested for one of Epstein's ex-assistants, though the name is not provided in the text.

The correspondence shows active investigative steps in the Maxwell case as of August 2020, involving the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The email chain indicates coordination between different law enforcement entities (NYPD, FBI, USAO) in gathering witness testimony or evidence.
